anley@...> wrote:

ncing.

> Ken, I agree with your points. As you say it does still=
 form an
> interesting baseline example of a real-time control task, much l=
ike
> XOR is a baseline task but not particularly interesting by itself.
> =

> Also the physics model point isn't particularly significant because
> it=
's already a simplification of the real world (no air or joint
> friction, =
outside vibration, air flow, etc.). It's a simple physics
> model that prov=
ides enough of the complexities of real word physics to
> stand as a good (=
but simple) control task.
> 
> Colin.
